name: operation, computer, desktop, with cathode ray tube display, standby mode | operation, computer, desktop, with cathode ray tube display, standby mode | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11349/documentation

The computer desktop use in the standby/sleep mode includes the share of computer production (CPU, keyboard, mouse, CRT) as well as the energy consumption (use-phase) and the rail and road transport from factory to user. Energy consumption of computer CPUs and CRT monitors (use-phase) vary a lot depending on the computer looked at. Min.-Max. values are listed; the mean value is calculated via the most likely value according to the reference data. Due to relatively vague literature data for computer and CRT life span, assumptions had to be made.;Child dataset exchanges identical to GLO dataset. Created to enable linking to regional markets (e.g. for electricity). Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.

Describes the use of a desktop computer with a CRT monitor in the standby/sleep mode. Calculated per 1 hour of computer use. Computer life span assumed to be 4 years, for the CRT monitor 6 years. Standby/sleep mode 2 hours a day (office use), 240 days a year.
category: J:Information and communication/62:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities/620:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is based on information by international computer manufacturers and literature (standby/sleep mode consumption). ;Child dataset exchanges identical to GLO dataset. Created to enable linking to regional markets (e.g. for electricity). Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: No technology involved, except for the production of the desktop computer (including CRT, keyboard and mouse), which is described in another dataset.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: see Geography and Technology This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography Europe without Switzerland. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.Child dataset exchanges identical to GLO dataset. Created to enable linking to regional markets (e.g. for electricity). Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
